 1.2 Land Status and Usage
 Most of the tenement lies on the Riverina Pastoral Station (H91303). Part of the eastern edge of the 
 tenement overlies Crown Reserve 49153, Sculptures – Land Exhibition Site (Sculptures on Lake 
 Ballard), and ANCA Wetland: AW/58, Lake Ballard.
 A search of the Native Title Register shows that the Project is not currently subject to any native title 
 1.3 Tenement Details and Project Structure
 The tenement location is illustrated in Figure 2 and tenement details are presented in Table A.

17.text: Structurally the dominant features are north striking, east dipping reverse faults (De, D1, D2) and

text:
The Snake Hill area is dominantly metabasalt and metadolerites of tholeiitic parentage with lesser 
 metagabbros and komatiites. Small post tectonic granitoids intrude the sequence with locally higher-
 grade metamorphic conditions (Figure 4). 
 Structurally the dominant features are north striking, east dipping reverse faults (De, D1, D2) and

18.text: associated anastomosing strain zones. A conjugate set of late brittle structures striking northeast and

20.text: The Mt Ida belt is widely mineralised with discordant vein gold deposits. Associated metals typically

21.text: include copper and arsenic but neither has been identified in economic concentrations. There is some

22.text: nickel sulphide mineralisation associated with the komatiite component of the supracrustals and the

23.text: area includes a locally significant beryl deposit sporadically mined for emeralds.

text:
associated anastomosing strain zones. A conjugate set of late brittle structures striking northeast and 
 northwest (D3) is also evident.
 The Mt Ida belt is widely mineralised with discordant vein gold deposits. Associated metals typically 
 include copper and arsenic but neither has been identified in economic concentrations. There is some 
 nickel sulphide mineralisation associated with the komatiite component of the supracrustals and the 
 area includes a locally significant beryl deposit sporadically mined for emeralds.

14.text:  Assessment of the tenements regional exploration potential

15.text: These exploration activities are discussed in detail within the following section.

text:
 Assessment of the tenements regional exploration potential
 These exploration activities are discussed in detail within the following section.

7.text: A staged program to investigate the area has been implemented by Riverina Resources. This work

8.text: program is designed to maximise the opportunity for Riverina Resources to generate an early cash flow

9.text: through resource definition and mining of advanced gold targets, while at the same time developing

10.text: new gold and nickel exploration targets by using systematic regional exploration techniques.

text:
A staged program to investigate the area has been implemented by Riverina Resources. This work 
 program is designed to maximise the opportunity for Riverina Resources to generate an early cash flow 
 through resource definition and mining of advanced gold targets, while at the same time developing 
 new gold and nickel exploration targets by using systematic regional exploration techniques.

text:
Airborne and ground radiometric surveys conducted by Esso identified a significant surficial 
 radiometric anomaly under the western edge of Lake Ballard (Figure 6). This anomaly is three to four
 times background, 3km x 1.5km in size, and interpreted to be hosted in calcareous lake sediments 
 (Yeelirrie style mineralisation). Following ground seismic refraction, gravity, and magnetic surveys to 
 determine the likely depth of bedrock Esso drilled 13 RC holes to test what they considered to be the

14.text: analysed for uranium. These holes intersected the base of the lake sediments between 6m and 11m

15.text: depth and returned a best intersection of 65ppm U. As these results were not considered significant

16.text: enough to warrant further drilling Esso relinquished the project area. The holes that Esso drilled are

17.text: located adjacent to the east of tenement E30/293. As only limited drilling has been completed at this

18.text: target further drilling is warranted to determine if a smaller deposit is present.

text:
analysed for uranium. These holes intersected the base of the lake sediments between 6m and 11m 
 depth and returned a best intersection of 65ppm U. As these results were not considered significant 
 enough to warrant further drilling Esso relinquished the project area. The holes that Esso drilled are 
 located adjacent to the east of tenement E30/293. As only limited drilling has been completed at this 
 target further drilling is warranted to determine if a smaller deposit is present.
 Unfortunately, Lake Ballard is nationally recognised as an important wetland and listed in the 
 Directory of Important Wetlands in Australia (Environment Australia). The lake is listed on the 
 National Estate Register and is in the process of being listed as a RAMSAR wetland. The lake is 
 known to be an important area for waterfowl breeding and in particular for banded stilts. The lake and 
 fringing areas used by waterfowl for breeding and habitat sites is an Environmentally Sensitive Area
 and protected under the EPBC Act and associated Regulations. In addition, the lake also has cultural 
 significance to the local and wider community as it is renowned as a tourist draw-card due to the 
 installation of a series of metal sculptures on the lake bed. As it will be very difficult, if not impossible, 
 to gain permission to explore on the salt lake the target does not appear to be significant enough to 
 warrant tackling this beuocracy.
 Gold and nickel exploration conducted by Killoran and Heron Resources in the area of tenement 
 E30/293 consisted of 500m x 500m spaced BLEG soil sampling. Results from this soil sampling only 
 returned one sample with >5ppb Au (peak result: 9.39ppb Au) (Figure 7) and four samples with 
 >500ppm Ni (peak result: 704ppm Ni) (Figure 7).
 Ground checking of the tenement area revealed that much of the lease overlies north-northwest striking 
 sub-cropping and outcropping mafic ridges that are separated by colluvial and alluvial filled valleys 
 draining north-south and then east onto Lake Ballard. Even though there are significant areas of sub-
 cropping and outcropping mafic rocks no shallow historic gold workings have been identified within 
 the tenement. As most of this area is amenable to soil sampling the gold results returned are not 
 considered significant enough to warrant further exploration.
 The stratigraphy at Snake Hill is interpreted to young to the east. Tenement E30/293 overlies the 
 eastern edge of a significant north-northwest striking ultramafic unit that may be prospective for nickel 
 sulphide mineralisation, however the tenement does not overlie the footwall contact of this unit (Figure 
 8). The nickel in soil sampling results returned from this area do not indicate the potential for a 
 significant nickel sulphide deposit.
 Assessment of GSWA surface geology mapping within the tenement area has identified a 1.5km long 
 and 100m wide zone of silica capped ultramafic rocks near the northwestern edge of the tenement. 
 These silica capped ultramafic rocks are situated adjacent to sub-cropping serpentenised ultramafic 
 rocks and generally overlie weathered cumulate ultramafic rocks that may be prospective for nickel 
 laterite mineralisation.
 E30_293 ATR 2007
 Page 11

8.text: significant results. Following the identification of the potential nickel laterite target on tenement

9.text: E30/293 RAB drilling was planned to test this target, but could not be completed during the reporting

10.text: period due to the lack of availability of an appropriate drill rig. If exemption from expenditure is

11.text: granted for this tenement RAB drilling will be completed at this target during the next reporting period.

significant results. Following the identification of the potential nickel laterite target on tenement 
 E30/293 RAB drilling was planned to test this target, but could not be completed during the reporting

 granted for this tenement RAB drilling will be completed at this target during the next reporting period.
